text:
Avdotya Romanovna watched Razumihin intently. 

His heart raced under her gaze. 

Pulcheria Alexandrovna whispered, “I can’t leave him.” 

Razumihin replied, “You’ll spoil everything. Come outside.” 

“Why?” she asked, confused. 

“He’ll slip away again. He’s not well.” 

“Where will Dounia stay?” Pulcheria insisted. 

“Those lodgings are dangerous,” Razumihin warned. 

“I’ll speak to the landlady,” she said firmly. 

Nastasya lit their way, shadows flickering. 

Razumihin could barely contain his urgency. 

“Just think where you are!” he urged. 

Pulcheria shook her head, resolute. 

“I cannot leave him like this.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin urges Pulcheria Alexandrovna to leave Raskolnikov alone for the night to avoid further irritation.
